metadata.description: Curated database of breakthrough BCI/neural interface papers (2022-2026)

papers.title: Minimally invasive implantation of scalable high-density cortical microelectrode arrays for multimodal neural decoding and stimulation
papers.abstract_summary: Demonstrates a 1,024-channel thin-film microelectrode array with minimally invasive 'cranial micro-slit' implantation technique avoiding craniotomy. Achieved in porcine models and human cadavers with <20 min surgical time.
papers.relevance_notes: Directly comparable technology to Neuralace - validates high-channel thin-film approach and minimally invasive delivery

papers.title: Neuropixels 2.0: A miniaturized high-density probe for stable, long-term brain recordings
papers.abstract_summary: Introduces Neuropixels 2.0 with 5,120 recording sites on a single shank, enabling stable recordings from the same neurons for weeks to months in freely behaving animals.
papers.relevance_notes: Gold standard for high-density recording - benchmarking target for Neuralace channel density and stability

papers.title: Ultra-high-density Neuropixels probes improve detection and identification in neuronal recordings
papers.abstract_summary: Neuropixels Ultra achieves much smaller and denser recording sites than previous designs, improving single-neuron detection and spike sorting accuracy.
papers.relevance_notes: Latest evolution of high-density probes - technology direction indicator

papers.title: A high-performance speech neuroprosthesis
papers.abstract_summary: Demonstrates a speech BCI decoding attempted speech at 62 words per minute with 9.1% error rate in a patient with ALS, approaching natural conversation speeds.
papers.relevance_notes: Breakthrough for speech restoration - potential Neuralace application

papers.title: An accurate and rapidly calibrating speech neuroprosthesis
papers.abstract_summary: ALS patient regained nearly fluent speech using BCI that translates brain signals with up to 97% accuracy. Device transforms brain activity into text displayed on screen.
papers.relevance_notes: Clinical milestone for communication BCIs - demonstrates market potential

papers.title: Flexible high-density microelectrode arrays for closed-loop brain–machine interfaces: a review
papers.abstract_summary: Comprehensive review of flexible high-density MEAs for closed-loop BMIs, covering materials (polyimide, parylene, PDMS), fabrication techniques, and design strategies.
key_findings: Polyimide and parylene as preferred substrates
papers.relevance_notes: Direct technology review for Neuralace - covers flexible substrate materials and designs

papers.title: Advances in flexible high-density microelectrode arrays for brain-computer interfaces
papers.abstract_summary: Reviews clinical applications of flexible HD-MEAs including sensory enhancement, human-machine interfaces, and neurological disease treatment.
papers.relevance_notes: Latest review on clinical applications - market validation

papers.title: Wireless Recording in the Peripheral Nervous System with Ultrasonic Neural Dust
papers.abstract_summary: Demonstrates ultrasound-powered wireless neural recording using mm-scale 'neural dust' motes implanted in peripheral nerves of rats.
papers.relevance_notes: Neuralace press release mentions 'neural dust' concept - this is the foundational paper

papers.title: Syringe-injectable mesh electronics integrate seamlessly with minimal chronic immune response in the brain
papers.abstract_summary: Demonstrates that ultra-flexible mesh electronics can be injected into brain tissue and integrate seamlessly without chronic inflammation or scarring.
papers.relevance_notes: Foundational work for flexible, biocompatible neural interfaces - directly relevant to Neuralace 'lace' design

papers.title: Nanotopography-enhanced biomimetic coating maintains bioactivity after weeks of dry storage and improves chronic neural recording
papers.abstract_summary: Demonstrates nanotopography and bioactive modifications that create seamless neural tissue interface for chronic implants.
papers.relevance_notes: Directly applicable coating technology for Neuralace biocompatibility

papers.title: Revolutionizing brain‒computer interfaces: overcoming biocompatibility challenges in implantable neural interfaces
papers.abstract_summary: Comprehensive review of biocompatibility challenges in implantable BCIs, covering coating materials, design strategies, and failure modes.
papers.relevance_notes: Essential reference for Neuralace biocompatibility engineering

papers.title: Inner speech in motor cortex and implications for speech neuroprostheses
papers.abstract_summary: Demonstrates detection of inner speech from motor cortex, enabling BCI communication from thought alone without attempted vocalization.
papers.relevance_notes: Next-generation speech BCI capability - potential Neuralace feature

papers.title: Optimized deep brain stimulation for anterior cingulate cortex inhibition produces antidepressant-like effects in mice
papers.abstract_summary: Shows that inhibitory DBS produces rapid, long-lasting antidepressant effects by suppressing mood-regulating networks.
papers.relevance_notes: Key research for Neuralace depression treatment - identifies optimal stimulation parameters and targets

papers.title: Deep Brain Stimulation in Treatment-Resistant Psychiatric Disorders: Efficacy, Safety, and Future Directions
papers.abstract_summary: Reviews DBS applications in treatment-resistant psychiatric disorders including depression, OCD, and anxiety.
papers.relevance_notes: Comprehensive review of psychiatric DBS - essential for Neuralace mental health roadmap

papers.title: A narrative review of cortical visual prosthesis systems: the latest progress and significance of nanotechnology for the future
papers.abstract_summary: Reviews cortical visual prosthesis systems including Orion, focusing on nanotechnology advances for future development.
papers.relevance_notes: Essential reference for Blackrock's 2028 visual prosthesis goal

papers.title: Can bionic eyes restore vision? Breakthroughs, challenges, and future frontiers in ophthalmology
papers.abstract_summary: Comprehensive review of bionic eye technologies including retinal and cortical approaches.
key_findings: Higher resolution needed for useful vision
papers.relevance_notes: Vision restoration technology landscape - competitive intelligence

papers.title: Walking naturally after spinal cord injury using a brain-spine interface
papers.abstract_summary: Demonstrates a brain-spine interface that enabled a paralyzed patient to walk naturally by bridging the lesion with neural signals.
papers.relevance_notes: Demonstrates potential of high-channel BCIs for motor restoration

papers.title: High-density implantable neural electrodes and chips for massive neural recordings
papers.abstract_summary: Reviews design techniques for area-efficient, energy-efficient BCI readout chips from few channels to massive 10,000+ channel designs.
papers.relevance_notes: Directly addresses Neuralace's 10,000+ channel integration challenge

papers.title: Brain-Integrated Silicon Chip (BISC): Ultra-thin neural implant with tens of thousands of electrodes
papers.abstract_summary: BISC is an ultra-thin neural implant creating high-bandwidth wireless link between brain and computers, with tens of thousands of electrodes and on-chip AI.
papers.relevance_notes: Direct competitor technology announcement - comparable to Neuralace specs

papers.title: Material and design strategies for chronically-implantable neural probes
papers.abstract_summary: Reviews material and design strategies for chronic neural probe biocompatibility.
papers.relevance_notes: Design guidance for Neuralace chronic biocompatibility

papers.title: Long-term stability strategies of deep brain flexible neural interface
papers.abstract_summary: Reviews strategies for long-term stability of flexible deep brain interfaces, addressing chronic inflammation and electrode failure.
papers.relevance_notes: Directly addresses Neuralace's chronic implant stability challenge

key_journals.name: Nature Biomedical Engineering
key_journals.relevance: Primary journal for BCI technology papers
